author: Milan Stanojevic
title: ESP-INIT-001 Error in Fortnite: 4 Ways to Fix it
text:
You can experience various issues in Fortnite, but recently esp-init-001 Fortnite error has been plaguing both PC and console gamers. If you encounter this issue, then this guide should be able to help you fix it.

 How can I fix Fortnite error ESP-INIT-001? 
Before trying more complex solutions, try restarting your device by turning it off and on with the Power button. Few reported that using the VPN can also help.

 1. Clear reserved space 
 
 On your Xbox select highlight Fortnite . 
 Next, press the Menu button on the controller. 
 Select Manage game and add-ons .

 After that, choose Clear reserved space .

 Once the process is finished, try to start the game again. 
 
Keep in mind that this will help with ESP-INIT-001 Fortnite error on Xbox, but you can try similar steps on other platforms.

 2. Restore Fortnite license 
 
 Go to Settings . 
 Next, go to Users and Accounts and select Other . 
 Select the Restore Licenses option.

 

 3. Download different language 
 
 On PS5 highlight Fortnite and press the Options button. 
 Select Manage game content .

 Now download another language for the game. 
 Delete your previous language. 
 
This is just a workaround, but it might help with Fortnite error ESP-INIT-001 on PS5 or PS4.

 4. Other solutions to try 
 
 Try disabling your network connection and enabling it again. 
 Using a phone hotspot is a viable workaround. 
 Changing the DNS to 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4. can also help. 
 
If nothing else works, you can try reinstalling the game.

Fortnite error ESP-INIT-001 can affect various platforms, including PC and Nintendo Switch, but hopefully, you managed to fix it with our solutions.

This isn’t the only issue you can encounter, and we covered Fortnite error code 0 and as well as Error 6 in Fortnite in our previous articles so don’t miss them.

author: @KXIITV
title: Chickasaw Nation to help Sulphur, Marietta rebuild from storms
text: Chickasaw Nation to help Sulphur, Marietta rebuild from storms ADA, Okla. (KXII) - The Chickasaw Nation plans to help two Oklahoma communities rebuild after being hit by severe weather. Chickasaw Nation Governor Bill Anoatubby announced a fundraising initiative Thursday called the Business Rebuild and Recovery Campaign. The campaign’s goal is to help Sulphur and Marietta businesses recover from storm damage, according to [a press release](https://www.chickasaw.net/News/Press-Releases/Release/Chickasaw-Nation-Unveils-Bold-Initiative-to-Help-R-62475.aspx) from the Chickasaw Nation. The Chickasaw Nation has made a substantial financial contribution toward the $6 million fundraising goal. In Marietta, the project will focus on fixing damage caused by the tornado that [ripped through the town](https://www.kxii.com/2024/04/28/fatal-tornado-rips-through-marietta-destroying-multiple-buildings/) in April. In Sulphur, an architecture firm will be used to preserve the historic look of the downtown area, [which was also destroyed](https://www.kxii.com/2024/04/29/deadly-tornado-destroys-sulphur-downtown-leaving-30-people-injured/). The Business Rebuild and Recovery Campaign also plans to create a grant program to fund the costs of the design and construction of damaged businesses, according to the press release. The campaign has not yet released information on how affected businesses can apply for grants. Copyright 2024 KXII. All rights reserved.

author: archyde
title: Futsal (R1): “We are in our place” rejoices Mohamed Kebdi
text:
2024-02-29 19:04:00
Mohamed Kebdi, the founding president of Pont, is already thinking about the next financial year. The idea is to build a team with elements from the sector. “I’m not going to give five hundred balls to a stranger because he knows how to do three juggles. I understand that offering a Coke at the end of the match will at some point not be enough…” admits the heating-sanitary craftsman, instructed by someone…
